quote.msg: 做乜無人執行公民條例  拉9條友?

replies.msg:
Voluntary intoxication (as he claimed) is generally no defence to basic intent offences, e.g. assalt occasioning actual bodily harm (AOABH) and criminal damage, in which the form of mens rea consist of both intention and recklessness (R v Majewski [1977] (UKHL)). The test is whether D has been reckless in getting drunk (R v Coley, McGhee and Harris [2013]). If the answer is yes, then it does not matter whether at the time of committing the crime, D did not have the required intention nor being reckless.

An important point to note is that the defendant bears the evidential burden to raise the issue of intoxication, i.e. the defendant has to prove that he was drunk at the material time thereby negating the necessary mens rea for the offence he is charged.

I personally believe that, with the strength of the video, it is quite likely that the fat boy will be convicted of both criminal damage and malicious wounding/AOABH.

I hope this helps.

P.S. LL.B Graduate in the UK

quote.msg: 做乜無人執行公民條例  拉9條友?

Voluntary intoxication (as he claimed) is generally no defence to basic intent offences, e.g. assalt occasioning actual bodily harm (AOABH) and criminal damage, in which the form of mens rea consist of both intention and recklessness (R v Majewski [1977] (UKHL)). The test is whether D has been reckless in getting drunk (R v Coley, McGhee and Harris [2013]). If the answer is yes, then it does not matter whether at the time of committing the crime, D did not have the required intention nor being reckless.

An important point to note is that the defendant bears the evidential burden to raise the issue of intoxication, i.e. the defendant has to prove that he was drunk at the material time thereby negating the necessary mens rea for the offence he is charged.

I personally believe that, with the strength of the video, it is quite likely that the fat boy will be convicted of both criminal damage and malicious wounding/AOABH.

I hope this helps.

P.S. LL.B Graduate in the UK

根據刑事訴訟程序條例第101條：
（2)任何人可無需手令而逮捕任何他合理地懷疑犯了可逮捕的罪行的人。 (由1967年第70號第2條代替)
正如之前有巴打講到AOABH ( assault occasioning actual bodily harm) pursuant to s39 of offence against the person ordinance 最高刑罰為三年監禁，已經滿足左可逮捕罪行嘅條件。
及根據刑事訴訟程序條例第101A 條：
(1)任何人於防止罪案時或於進行或協助合法逮捕罪犯或疑犯或非法地不在羈留中的人時，可使用就當時環境而言屬於合理的武力。
(2)普通法中關於何時為第(1)款所述任何目的而使用武力，即因該目的而屬正當地使用武力的規定，由第(1)款予以取代。

留意s101A(1)中強調合理武力。所以如果下次見到有人打人，除左拍片以外，可以講到明係行使條例中給予嘅合法crime prevention 權利，然後幾個人夾手夾腳制服施暴者，並即刻連絡警方報案。

我明依家警方選擇性執法係無辦法解決，但希望各位同路人明白法律上各位係有用合理武力逮捕施暴者嘅權力。所以制服左依d仆街仔係可以加重施暴者嘅門檻同保護同路人與自己。但切記一定唔可以先出手，否則就會變成對家用合理武力逮捕你。

利申：HKU LLB undergraduate

根據刑事訴訟程序條例第101條：
（2)任何人可無需手令而逮捕任何他合理地懷疑犯了可逮捕的罪行的人。 (由1967年第70號第2條代替)
正如之前有巴打講到AOABH ( assault occasioning actual bodily harm) pursuant to s39 of offence against the person ordinance 最高刑罰為三年監禁，已經滿足左可逮捕罪行嘅條件。
及根據刑事訴訟程序條例第101A 條：
(1)任何人於防止罪案時或於進行或協助合法逮捕罪犯或疑犯或非法地不在羈留中的人時，可使用就當時環境而言屬於合理的武力。
(2)普通法中關於何時為第(1)款所述任何目的而使用武力，即因該目的而屬正當地使用武力的規定，由第(1)款予以取代。

留意s101A(1)中強調合理武力。所以如果下次見到有人打人，除左拍片以外，可以講到明係行使條例中給予嘅合法crime prevention 權利，然後幾個人夾手夾腳制服施暴者，並即刻連絡警方報案。

我明依家警方選擇性執法係無辦法解決，但希望各位同路人明白法律上各位係有用合理武力逮捕施暴者嘅權力。所以制服左依d仆街仔係可以加重施暴者嘅門檻同保護同路人與自己。但切記一定唔可以先出手，否則就會變成對家用合理武力逮捕你。

利申：HKU LLB undergraduate

quote.msg: 做乜無人執行公民條例  拉9條友?

Voluntary intoxication (as he claimed) is generally no defence to basic intent offences, e.g. assalt occasioning actual bodily harm (AOABH) and criminal damage, in which the form of mens rea consist of both intention and recklessness (R v Majewski [1977] (UKHL)). The test is whether D has been reckless in getting drunk (R v Coley, McGhee and Harris [2013]). If the answer is yes, then it does not matter whether at the time of committing the crime, D did not have the required intention nor being reckless.

An important point to note is that the defendant bears the evidential burden to raise the issue of intoxication, i.e. the defendant has to prove that he was drunk at the material time thereby negating the necessary mens rea for the offence he is charged.

I personally believe that, with the strength of the video, it is quite likely that the fat boy will be convicted of both criminal damage and malicious wounding/AOABH.

I hope this helps.

P.S. LL.B Graduate in the UK
